Event.0: David Letterman—who redefined American talk shows with his unconventional humour and innovative segments—stepped down as host of the Late Show with David Letterman.
Event.2: Hubble Space Telescope sends its 1st photographs from space
Event.3: "Every Breath You Take" single released by The Police (Billboard Song of the Year 1983)
Event.4: Soldier and later politician Lee Hsien Loong marries first wife doctor Wong Ming Yang
Event.5: "The Who" guitarist and songwriter Pete Townshend (23) weds Karen Astley in England
Event.6: American singer and actress Cher, who was known for her flamboyant style, was born.
Event.7:
Cher
American actress and singer
was born
Event.8:
José Mujica
president of Uruguay
was born
Event.9: At 7:40 AM, Charles Lindbergh takes off from New York to cross the Atlantic for Paris, aboard Spirit of St Louis (1st non-stop flight)
Event.10: Saudi Arabia becomes independent of Great Britain in the Treaty of Jeddah
Event.11:
Moshe Dayan
Israeli statesman
was born
Event.12: American motion-picture star Jimmy Stewart was born in Indiana, Pennsylvania.
Event.13:
James Stewart
American actor
was born
Event.14: 2nd modern Olympic games opens in Paris (lasted 5 months)
Event.15: History of cinema: The first public display of Thomas Edison's prototype kinetoscope to members of the National Federation of Women's Club
Event.16: Germany, Austria-Hungary, and Italy secretly formed the Triple Alliance, a treaty organization that provided for mutual protection against attacks by other European powers until Italy entered World War I.
Event.17: Levi Strauss and Jacob Davis were granted a patent for using copper rivets to strengthen certain areas of trousers, notably pocket corners; the patent was credited with giving rise to blue jeans.
Event.18: Spotsylvania campaign in US Civil War ends after 10,920 killed or injured
Event.19: US Homestead Act becomes law which provides cheap land for the settlement of the American West
Event.20:
U.S. Homestead Act signed
On this day in 1862, U.S. President Abraham Lincoln signed the Homestead Act, which provided 160 acres of public land virtually free of charge to those who had lived on and cultivated the land for at least five years.
Event.21:
John Stuart Mill
British philosopher and economist
was born
Event.22: Economist and philosopher John Stuart Mill was born in London.
Event.23: The Netherlands yielded to Great Britain some of its holdings in India and Indonesia in a treaty signed as part of the Peace of Paris, a collection of treaties that concluded the American Revolution.
Event.24: Prime Minister of Great Britain Frederick North (24) weds heiress Anne Speke
Event.25: Shakespeare's Sonnets are first published in London, perhaps illicitly, by publisher Thomas Thorpe
Event.26: Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama arrives at Calicut, India becoming the first European to reach India by sea
